texts.label: text
texts.orig: If your server is spewing an invalid HELO, you could be blacklisted pretty quickly. The  Spamhaus SBL-XBL  list and  CBL  list work together to find servers announcing themselves improperly.
texts.text: If your server is spewing an invalid HELO, you could be blacklisted pretty quickly. The  Spamhaus SBL-XBL  list and  CBL  list work together to find servers announcing themselves improperly.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The common reasons why mail servers are blocked for bad HELO's are:
texts.text: The common reasons why mail servers are blocked for bad HELO's are:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Server is announcing itself as “localhost”.
texts.text: Server is announcing itself as “localhost”.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Server is announcing itself as an IP address.
texts.text: Server is announcing itself as an IP address.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Server is announcing itself as a hostname that does not exist.
texts.text: Server is announcing itself as a hostname that does not exist.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Are you unsure what your server's announcing itself as? Try these:
texts.text: Are you unsure what your server's announcing itself as? Try these:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Send an e-mail to helocheck@cbl.abuseat.org. You will get an immediate response with exactly what your HELO contains.
texts.text: Send an e-mail to helocheck@cbl.abuseat.org. You will get an immediate response with exactly what your HELO contains.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Telnet to port 25 on your mailserver. Run
texts.text: Telnet to port 25 on your mailserver. Run

texts.label: text
texts.orig: So your server is announcing itself as the wrong thing? Well, fix it!
texts.text: So your server is announcing itself as the wrong thing? Well, fix it!

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Managing HELO with QMail
texts.text: Managing HELO with QMail

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If  /var/qmail/control/me  exists, edit it so that it matches your reverse DNS record for your server's primary IP address. If the file doesn't exist, you can create the file and add the correct hostname to it, or adjust your hostname on your operating system. Try running
texts.text: If  /var/qmail/control/me  exists, edit it so that it matches your reverse DNS record for your server's primary IP address. If the file doesn't exist, you can create the file and add the correct hostname to it, or adjust your hostname on your operating system. Try running

texts.label: code
texts.orig: hostname mail.yourdomain.com
texts.text: hostname mail.yourdomain.com

texts.label: text
texts.orig: to fix things immediately, and edit the proper configuration files to correct your hostname at boot time.
texts.text: to fix things immediately, and edit the proper configuration files to correct your hostname at boot time.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Managing HELO with Postfix
texts.text: Managing HELO with Postfix

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The default value for Postfix's HELO is the value of
texts.text: The default value for Postfix's HELO is the value of

texts.label: code
texts.orig: $myhostname
texts.text: $myhostname

texts.label: text
texts.orig: . If that variable is defined in the main.cf, adjust it so that it matches the reverse DNS record of your server. If it isn't defined in main.cf, then adjust the hostname on your operating system. Try running
texts.text: . If that variable is defined in the main.cf, adjust it so that it matches the reverse DNS record of your server. If it isn't defined in main.cf, then adjust the hostname on your operating system. Try running

texts.label: code
texts.orig: hostname mail.yourdomain.com
texts.text: hostname mail.yourdomain.com

texts.label: text
texts.orig: to fix things immediately, and edit the proper configuration files to correct your hostname at boot time. Should neither of those methods suffice on your server, simply adjust the
texts.text: to fix things immediately, and edit the proper configuration files to correct your hostname at boot time. Should neither of those methods suffice on your server, simply adjust the

texts.label: code
texts.orig: smtp_helo_name
texts.text: smtp_helo_name

texts.label: text
texts.orig: variable to match the reverse DNS record of your server. For example:
texts.text: variable to match the reverse DNS record of your server. For example:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: smtp_helo_name = mail.yourdomain.com
texts.text: smtp_helo_name = mail.yourdomain.com

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Managing HELO with Sendmail
texts.text: Managing HELO with Sendmail

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Adjust the hostname on your operating system. Try running
texts.text: Adjust the hostname on your operating system. Try running

texts.label: code
texts.orig: hostname mail.yourdomain.com
texts.text: hostname mail.yourdomain.com

texts.label: text
texts.orig: to fix things immediately, and edit the proper configuration files to correct your hostname at boot time.
texts.text: to fix things immediately, and edit the proper configuration files to correct your hostname at boot time.
